programme.title: Rage
programme.desc: Australias longest running music TV show, rage is home to the biggest vault of music videos from a diverse range of artists, genres and eras. We curate the best clips of all time to surprise and entertain you for hours.

programme.title: Parkinson In Australia
programme.desc: In 1982 Michael Parkinson spoke with Sir Edmund Hillary and Twiggy.

Were there enough security arrangements in place before the Bondi attack? Is the social media ban actually working? Plus, hopes the algal bloom that devastated South Australias beaches may be improving. (Final for 2025)

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across the day. Presented by Melissa Mackay.

programme.title: The Forsytes
programme.desc: Disaster strikes at Forsyte and Co. as Soames puts an end to Irenes Parisian dreams. Louisa faces a shock eviction. Can Jolyon save the day?

programme.title: Grand Designs Australia
programme.desc: In Yarraville, Victoria, a passive house builder starts a crusade to build the healthiest home in Australia on the site of an old pigeon club house! (Final)

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Nikki and Jack investigate a murder bearing all the hallmarks of a notorious serial killer. When a womans body is removed from a reservoir Nikki performs the post-mortem and confirms she is the deceased wife of Charles Beck.

programme.title: rage Best of the Charts 2025
programme.desc: rage rounds up the hottest chart-toppers of the 2025 ARIA Singles Charts.

programme.title: Rage
programme.desc: Keep the party vibe going every Saturday morning with wall-to-wall music videos, from classic hits and long-forgotten tracks from the rage vault, to the latest new releases and special features.

programme.title: ABC News At Noon
programme.desc: Melissa Mackay presents the latest from ABC News on the weekend bringing you todays top stories and coverage of events as they unfold. Plus original reporting, analysis and updated news, sport, weather and information.

programme.title: Royal Carols: Together At Christmas
programme.desc: The Princess of Wales returns to host her very special annual Christmas carol service featuring songs, musical performances and readings.

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: DCI Vera Stanhope is on track to uncover an intriguing yet puzzling case when the body of a sickly young girl is discovered at the side of an isolated railway crossing.

programme.title: Good Game Spawn Point
programme.sub-title: Cities: Skylines Ii and Sonic Superstars!
programme.desc: This week on GGSP; we review the epic city building of Cities: Skylines II, speedrun our way through a Sonic Superstars review, and some special guests from Turn Up The Volume join the Spawn Squad!

programme.title: The Inbestigators
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Vanishing Koalas
programme.desc: Kakow Koalas are the latest snack sensation sweeping the playground and Mario is hungry for justice when his are stolen.

programme.title: Malory Towers
programme.desc: June is horrified to learn that Mr Murray is planning to chop down the Malory Oak Tree to try and find a hidden chamber beneath it, leading her to stage a dramatic protest to save the tree!

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: The gang track a scary alien monster to Area 53!

programme.title: The Powerpuff Girls
programme.desc: When Blossom makes a bad call, she becomes afraid to try again.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: The Farmer wants a family photo and instructs Bitzer to gather all the animals together. Getting them all to stand still at the same time is more than they can manage and Shaun discovers hes cut out of the shot!

programme.title: Star Wars: Young Jedi Adventures
programme.sub-title: The Search for the Missing Dunnels
programme.desc: Lys sets out to retrieve escaped creatures.

programme.title: Good Game Spawn Point
programme.sub-title: Warioware: Move It! And Spawn Squad!
programme.desc: This week on GGSP: we get moving with the mini-game fuelled mayhem of WarioWare: Move It! Plus, Granny Gem shares her guide to game genres, and Logan joins the Spawn Squad!

programme.title: Rage
programme.desc: Keep the party vibe going with wall-to-wall music videos, from new releases to classics and the long-forgotten.

programme.title: The Inbestigators
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Very Lost Notebook
programme.desc: When Maudie loses her beloved notebook Ezra, Ava and Kyle band together to reunite their friend with her most prized possession.

programme.title: Scooby-Doo And Guess Who?
programme.sub-title: Now You Sia, Now You Dont!
programme.desc: The gang track a ghostly doppelganger that looks like Sia.

programme.title: The Powerpuff Girls
programme.desc: The Fashionistas create brainwashing clothes.

programme.title: ABC Kids Programs Resume At 4am
programme.desc: ABC Kids programs resume at 4.00am

programme.title: Merry Madagascar
programme.desc: When Santa and his reindeer crash onto the island of Madagascar, its up to Alex, Marty, Gloria, Melman and those wacky penguins to save Christmas.

programme.title: Officially Amazing
programme.desc: Jet powered flips, spiders on the body and a barrel-riding dog attempt to break world records.

programme.title: Good Game Spawn Point
programme.desc: This week on GGSP: We go on an adventure with the Heeler family in our review of Bluey: The Videogame! Plus, we speedrun our way through a review of the treacherous climbing of Jusant, and Mevin joins the Spawn Squad!

programme.title: Live At The Apollo
programme.desc: A special festive edition hosted by the fabulous Tom Allen, who introduces Thanyia Moore and Lloyd Griffith to the stage.

programme.title: The Next Step
programme.desc: Auditions continue, and a new A-troupe is formed, ending the journey to nationals for some and creating a new beginning for others.

programme.title: Moominvalley
programme.desc: Moomintroll faces his toughest challenge yet when he wakes up too early from hibernation. To survive the perils of deepest winter, he must first find his primal side with the help of a strange, ancient ancestor. (Final)

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: Timmy accidentally eats a tomato grown with Miracle-Grow fertiliser and expands to become the King Kong of sheep. Shaun must keep the giant toddler out of sight while trying to figure out how to return him to normal size.

programme.title: Total Drama Island
programme.desc: The final 4 get must wander through a dark and spooky cave hunting for coins. The challenge only gets worse when they discover that something is also hunting them.

programme.title: We Baby Bears
programme.desc: While exploring a lantern festival, the Bears encounter Pandas long-lost family.

programme.title: Steven Universe
programme.desc: Stevens desire for some alone time unlocks a new room in the Temple that answers his every wish.

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: Its not often you find a house with carpet on the walls - but this is what Phil discovers in York. Steve and Jacqui Shipleys bungalow has been on the market for almost a year but Phils determined to help them sell.

programme.title: Semi-pro
programme.desc: In 1970s Michigan, the age of big hair and short shorts, one man goes all the way in his search for glory and redemption.

programme.title: Rage
programme.sub-title: rage Vault Guest Programmer: The Prodigy (1996)
programme.desc: Australias longest running music TV show, rage is home to the biggest vault of music videos from a diverse range of artists, genres and eras. We curate the best clips of all time to surprise and entertain you for hours.

programme.title: Death In Paradise
programme.desc: Florences undercover role takes a dangerous turn when she finds herself in familiar surroundings, amid a murder investigation. In a race against time, can Neville solve the murder?

programme.title: The Next Step
programme.desc: Richelle and Shad hold auditions to find a soloist to be the lead in Step Inside.

programme.title: Moominvalley
programme.desc: When a charismatic winter sports champion arrives in the valley, Moomintroll struggles to win back Snorkmaidens affections.

programme.title: Hotel Transylvania: The Series
programme.desc: When Mavis innocently fibs that today is her birthday, it sets off a chain of events that leads to a very confused Gary Death starting over and - poof - making Mavis a baby again.

programme.title: Badjelly
programme.desc: Tim and Rose meet Binklebonk, a tree goblin living in fear of The Beast of The Backwoods.

programme.title: Heartbreak High
programme.desc: Kurt is worried about tension within the group and offers a solution.

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: Donald Fergusons semi has been on the market for two long years. Phils determined to help but when Donny realises this means removing the masses of mahogany that make his house seem small and dark, hes unconvinced.

programme.title: Melbourne Comedy Festival Gala
programme.desc: Luke McGregor hosts comedys night of nights - The Melbourne International Comedy Festival Gala for Oxfam, featuring Tommy Little, Geraldine Hickey, Lloyd Langford, Cal Wilson, Nikki Britton, Sammy J, Alex Ward and more.

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous
programme.desc: Eddy and Patsy take the baby to her first modelling job - a photo shoot at the zoo. Jean-Paul Gaultier is on location, much to their delight, but will they manage to return baby Jane home safely?

programme.title: Star Wars: Young Jedi Adventures
programme.desc: Nash and the young Jedi transport a princess.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: The visitors land on the Moon and begin to explore. They meet some friendly aliens and have fun making Sandcastles and sharing their picnic. Nanny creates a Jelly flood but luckily the Aliens love to eat Jelly!

programme.title: Twirlywoos
programme.desc: The Twirlywoos watch a man practising his tennis strokes using a machine to shoot the balls to him, which prompts them to learn more about speed.

programme.title: Daniel Tigers Neighbourhood
programme.desc: Daniel is frustrated when Juan Carlos doesnt pretend the same way he does. Dad shows them they can pretend in different ways

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: George pays a visit to Mr Foxs Shop after his favourite toy, Mr Dinosaur breaks. With all the additional features surely Dino Roar is a good replacement?

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.desc: Paddington meets Mateos dog, Lucky. He tries to teach him tricks, but Lucky will not behave.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: When Captain Squid leaves his treasure map in the Little Kingdom, Redbeard leads Ben, Holly and Nanny Plum on a treasure hunt. The map says the treasure is deep under water and guarded by a mermaid and a golden sea monster!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Today, Mummy and Daddy big are going to antenatal class while Peppa and George go to sibling school. Together, they learn all about babies and how to be the best siblings!

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: When the cadets are put in charge of running the lifeguard club all by themselves, it proves to be the toughest - and most rewarding - day of their lives.

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: Volcanic smoke blocks the three Proximan suns and cause Big Lizard to become worryingly cold. Cosimas on the case and comes up with a super-hot solution!

programme.title: Play School
programme.desc: Emma and Kaeng make a fantastic feast of cauliflower cake and tabouleh salad. We see a family celebrating Eid al-Fitr with more festive food and fireworks, and Through The Windows, were invited to a birthday party!

programme.title: Mixmups
programme.desc: The Mixmups build a nature box and decide to try and find someone to live in their home. But when their new friend doesnt want to live in the box, can tey find another way to make it happy?

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Coco and Charlie are playing at Bings house when Coco spots the measuring lines on the wall that show how Bing has grown. Flop measures Bing and hes bigger than last time.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: When Mums sister Brandy comes over for a visit, she brings the kids onesies as a present, which has an unexpected effect on Bingo!

programme.title: Mister Maker Around The World
programme.desc: Mister Maker travels the world and meets lots of Mini Makers along the way. In Australia, find out if he can make an egg-cellent egg diver and in Hong Kong, discover how to make some really handy art!

programme.title: Thomas And Friends: All Engines Go
programme.desc: Percy takes a game of super-heroes and villains too far and hurts his friends feelings and accidentally becomes Sodors best bad guy.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and her family take Goldie the Fish to Doctor Hamster for her check-up. Dr Hamster wishes she could exercise more, so Grampy Rabbit decides to build something to help.

programme.title: Ginger And The Vegesaurs
programme.desc: Split chases a glowing Chillipede into the depths of the Spooky Forest and gets lost inside an overgrown tree-root maze, where the only way out is to follow the sounds of Ginger and the other Baby Pea-Rexes.

programme.title: Tish Tash
programme.desc: Pola has forgotten to buy the meat for the family barbecue so, to avoid the barbecue being postponed, Tish proposes they hunt for vegetables for the barbecue instead.

programme.title: Builder Brothers Dream Factory
programme.desc: The Dream Factory Crew converts the Cruiser into the ultimate treasure hunting machine to track down a very special treasure buried by Principal Pittman when he was a boy.

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.sub-title: The Octonauts And The Snapping Shrimp
programme.desc: The Octonauts encounter a Snapping Shrimp, a small creature that uses its claws to make a big (and stunning) noise.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Tags feeling grumpy because he didnt eat his breakfast. Luckily Duggee has his Breakfast Badge, so he can make whatever the Squirrels would like to eat - as it turns out they all like very different things for breakfast!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: When Hannah turns the Pontypandy Ocean Parade into a race, an ocean rescue is required.

programme.title: Play School: Make and Create
programme.desc: Zindzi and Alex are decorating tucker boxes for the toys using bits and bobs from The Useful Box! Special guest Dave showcases his cake decorating skills, and we visit Humptys Sandwich Van for Build Your Own Sandwich Day!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Doctor Hamster comes to school to talk about butterflies. The children paint caterpillars, make butterfly wings and even dance the life cycle of a butterfly.

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: Cosima and Big Lizard find some fascinatingly slippery fruit but bringing it safely back to the ship is more challenging than they imagined!

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: Pounce role-plays as legendary lifeguard Super Roo. Meanwhile, Frizzy helps Wanda make a Big Thing.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: With the PJ Masks help, Newton learns that hes not just "brains"; he can also use his powers to stop Romeo.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Its a lovely day and the squirrels are outside playing the Shape game. When it starts to rain, the squirrels have to hurry to find each animal a dry place but working out which animal goes where is a question of shape.

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Evil Pea is causing chaos in the veggie aisle with a fan powered trolley filled with a stinky cheese.

programme.title: Star Wars: Young Jedi Adventures
programme.desc: Kais bad day worsens when a simple mission goes awry.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: On a tour of the Elf Factory, the Elf and Fairy children learn about recycling and see how rubbish is re-used and made into toys. When the factory runs out of raw material, they set out to find some more.

programme.title: Twirlywoos
programme.desc: An octopus jumps on and off Peekaboo, before jumping on and off the Twirlywoos.

programme.title: Daniel Tigers Neighbourhood
programme.desc: Chrissie gets upset when O plays horse differently than her. X shows them that there are so many ways to pretend.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Miss Rabbits train has broken down with a carriage full of passengers who need to get to work. Grandpa Pig lends Miss Rabbit his little train Gertrude.

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.desc: Mr Gruber gives Paddington a Chinese finger trap, Paddington gets attached to Mr Curry and they are stuck together whilst auditioning for the Windsor Gardens play.

programme.title: Ariel
programme.desc: Ariel tracks down a mythological sea creature. Ariel and friends get a substitute teacher in music class.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Jacks the new dog at school and the newest recruit in Rustys army. Jack struggles with following instructions and always forgets his hat,Ã‚ but Rusty will make a soldier of him yet.

programme.title: Knee High Spies
programme.desc: When Silver Paw tries to fly to the moon in a bottle rocket, Jeremy and Squash take to the skies to save her.

programme.title: Fizzy And Suds
programme.desc: Fizzy and Suds meet the penguins! See them snuggle, waddle, nap, and slide. From gentoo to king penguins, its a chilly, splashy, fishy adventure full of fun.

programme.title: Super Monsters And The Wish Star
programme.desc: The Super Monsters celebrate Christmas with a magical Wish Star that grants heartfelt wishes and sparks chaos, teaching lessons about teamwork, friendship, and the joy of the holiday spirit.

programme.title: Maddie + Triggs
programme.desc: Maddie is annoyed when the wind takes her paper bird away, but soon both she and Triggs are blown away on a magical adventure that celebrates all the things the wind can do.

programme.title: Andy And The Band
programme.desc: The band turn detective to go in search of a missing flying disc. Can they crack the case?

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Doctor Hamster comes to school to talk about butterflies. The children paint caterpillars, make butterfly wings and even dance the life cycle of a butterfly.

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: Its been one year since Cosima crash-landed on Proxima, but no one else has remembered this anniversary! Can a perfect picnic jolt their memories?

programme.title: Tish Tash
programme.desc: Tish and Bobby are having trouble finishing their vegetables during dinner time so, Rosa and Pola have taken away the cake until they are finished.

programme.title: Builder Brothers Dream Factory
programme.desc: Drew, Jonathan and the rest of their Crew turn the Dream Factory into an amusement park to celebrate Carloss birthday.

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.sub-title: The Octonauts And The Giant Whirlpool
programme.desc: The Octonauts race against time to rescue Tweaks pal, a Leatherback Sea Turtle whos caught in a fast-moving ocean current thats sucking it into a whirlpool.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Duggee is putting up a picture of himself with his old friends that he grew up with, who are just like family to him. This inspires the Squirrels to take a photo of their own!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: When James, Mandy and Annie use the horse and cart to deliver their cherry pop to The Taste of Pontypandy competition, chaos ensues!

programme.title: Millie Magnificent
programme.desc: When Miles misses out on seeing a beautiful rainbow, Millie tries to recreate one for her little brother, in her very own home.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: Tammy and Molly learn about different miniclimates in the garden and even create their own - a terrarium!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George are watching Detective Potato on television. When Daddy loses his car in the car park, Detective Potato appears and saves the day!

programme.title: Peter Rabbit
programme.sub-title: The Tale Of The Lost Journal
programme.desc: When Benjamin accidentally loses Peters dads journal it falls into the clutches of Mr Tod...

programme.title: Octonauts: Above And Beyond
programme.desc: A rainy season storm in the West African Savanna interests Paani, until a mudslide sends Tunip and the Terra-Gup 1 tumbling into a ditch. Luckily, a mysterious nocturnal creature, a pangolin, helps with the rescue.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: In the park Bluey meets a new playmate Winnie, but when Bluey wants to invite her and her dad home for breakfast, she learns that adults take a little bit longer to make friends.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Duggee is going to make the squirrels juice from lots of lovely fresh fruit in the garden. Whilst they are picking all the fruit the Squirrels meet a little bug, full of woes about being too small.

programme.title: Piripenguins
programme.desc: Pancake saves Flutter who vows to repay him, but his behaviour drives Pan to distraction.

programme.desc: Bridget, James, Catherine, Nate and Steph Ferrier hear from Paul Mescal and Josh OConnor about their film The History of Sound plus Zak Hepburn, Casey Donovan and Chocolate Queen Kirsten Tibballs with a seasonal showstopper.

programme.desc: Jim Maxwell bowls an over of memories with his six favourite Ashes Moments. The final one comes from 2005 at Edgbaston, as England claimed an astonishing victory that spawned the iconic Brett Lee/Andrew Flintoff photo.

programme.desc: John Anderson, AC, farmer, grazier and former deputy prime minister, whose talk, Our Civilisational Moment argues that Australia lacks the spirit, not the machinery of democracy.

programme.desc: When you need to know whats happening turn to ABC News for coverage you can trust. Meredith Sheehan brings you the days news by reporters in more locations across Australia, connecting communities and telling your stories.

programme.title: ABC Nightly News
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time for transparency and trust. ABC News brings you todays top stories and latest news, with more reporters to tell you whats going on and why it matters. Presented by Meredith Sheehan.

programme.desc: When you need to know whats happening turn to ABC News for coverage you can trust. Meredith Sheehan brings you the days news by reporters in more locations across Australia, connecting communities and telling your stories.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Live across Australia, the latest headlines and the days top stories from ABC News. We have reporters on the ground connecting communities, telling your stories and bringing you coverage of whats happening as it unfolds.
